segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's surprising how she hasn't noticed the puddle forming at her feet, even though she's standing right next to it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really focused on her task, tuning out everything else around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are being so mischievous, and she has no idea what's going on.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit sad that she's missing out on what's happening in her own kitchen, right behind her back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she'll ever realize what's been going on while she's been drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she turns around soon and sees the children before they cause any trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between her calm demeanor and the overflowing sink is quite striking, and a bit sad.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she might be in for a surprise when she finally looks down and sees the puddle at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit sorry for her, having to deal with the mess and the mischievous children all at once.
segments.speaker: PAR
